meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mother, especially in being nurturing or protective.
meanings.sent1: The mumsy lady at the park always had snacks for the children.
meanings.sent2: She wore a mumsy apron while baking cookies for the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mumsy hen gathered her chicks under her wings during the storm.
meanings.sent4: Her mumsy nature made her the go-to person for advice among friends.
meanings.sent5: The mumsy nurse comforted the scared child before the surgery.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of style or fashion sense, typically associated with older women.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit was a bit mumsy with the floral print and sensible shoes.
meanings.sent2: The mumsy sweater she wore was cozy but not very trendy.
meanings.sent3: Despite her mumsy attire, she always had a smile that lit up the room.
meanings.sent4: The mumsy hat she wore added a touch of whimsy to her look.
meanings.sent5: Even in her mumsy dress, she exuded confidence and grace.
